channel.title: Non Wild area.. [317]
channel.description: Yeah.. I need some help.. I wonder if I'm doing this wrong but heres my code.. public boolean nonWild() { || (absX >= 3303 && absX <= 3308 && absY >= 9370 && absY <= 9380) || (absX >= 2751 && absX <= 2765 && absY >= 3492 && absY <= 3504) || (absX >= 3273 && absX <= 3270 && absY >= 2784 && absY <= 2785) || (absX >= 3540 && absX <= 3544 && absY >= 3557 && absY <= 3550) When I add that at the bottom they don't seem to be working.. Am I supposed to do something else ?

item.title: Non Wild area.. [317]
item.dc:creator: @shadytheone shadytheone
item.description:
@shadytheone wrote:

This may be the hardest or the easiest part, follow this way;.

If your making a wilderness zone to a safe zone, Get the coords of one area, next go east, then so on, meaning say you do North, East, South, West, i suggest you no clip so you can walk through the objects, so you need the West X coordinate, then the East X Coord.

It should look like this so far:
Fill In The Coords On The : ####

|| (absX >= #### && absX <= ####
Now, go anywhere on that line of those 2 coords. Then get the Y coordinate, then go up as far as you want, and get the next Y coordinate.

You should get something like this:

absY >= #### && absY <= ####
Now once you got those 2 codes, you simply put them together like this:

|| (absX >= #### && absX <= #### && absY >= #### && absY <= ####)
Now there you go , hope it helped?

Read full topic

item.title: Non Wild area.. [317]

item.description:

Yeah… I need some help… I wonder if I’m doing this wrong but heres my code…
public boolean nonWild() {
|| (absX >= 3303 && absX <= 3308 && absY >= 9370 && absY <= 9380)
|| (absX >= 2751 && absX <= 2765 && absY >= 3492 && absY <= 3504)
|| (absX >= 3273 && absX <= 3270 && absY >= 2784 && absY <= 2785)
|| (absX >= 3540 && absX <= 3544 && absY >= 3557 && absY <= 3550)
When I add that at the bottom they don’t seem to be working… Am I supposed to do something else ?
